double_jeopardy.category: THE NEW YORK FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE YEARS

clues.category: THE NEW YORK FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE YEARS
clues.clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew stands next to a fire engine in the NYC Fire Museum.)  The 1970s were one of the New York City Fire Department’s most challenging times; Howard Cosell said on TV, this borough "is burning", & firemen were often called there daily

clues.category: THE NEW YORK FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE YEARS
clues.clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew walks next to an antique pump engine in the NY City Fire Museum.)  This double-decker engine was part of the festivities when this opened in New York Harbor on October 28, 1886

clues.category: THE NEW YORK FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE YEARS
clues.clue: (Kelly holds a tiny fire helmet in the NY City Fire Museum.) The 343 doesn't represent a fire company; it represents this number from the New York City Fire Department's saddest day

clues.category: THE NEW YORK FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE YEARS
clues.clue: (Sarah walks next to another antique pump engine at the NY City Fire Museum.) A 19th century fire chief worried engines powered by this were so mighty that the water would cause more damage than the fires

clues.category: THE NEW YORK FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE YEARS
clues.clue: (Sarah walks around a decorated antique hose reel in the NY City Fire Museum.) The infamous Boss Tweed began his public career as a volunteer fireman & this hose reel from his era had the tiger symbol of this organization

final_jeopardy.clue: The 2 outlets of the Gulf of Mexico, a strait & a channel, bear the names of these 2 land areas

double_jeopardy: THE NEW YORK FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE YEARS
